title: Indefinite integral of 1/x
description: In differential âcalculusÂ we learned that the derivative of ln(x) is 1/x. Integration goes the other way: the integral (or antiderivative) of 1/x should be a function whose derivative is 1/x. As we just saw, this is ln(x). However, if x is negative then ln(x) is undefined! The solution is quite simple: the antiderivative of 1/x is ln(|x|).

description: The first part of the fundamental theorem of calculus tells us that if we define ð(ð¹) to be the definite integral of function Æ from some constant ð¢ to ð¹, then ð is an antiderivative of Æ. In other words, ð'(ð¹)=Æ(ð¹). See why this is so.

title: Converting explicit series terms to summation notation
description: Some sums are really long, but we can use sigma notation to write them in a shorthand way. See such an example here.

title: Intuition for second part of fundamental theorem of calculus
description: The second part of the fundamental theorem of calculus tells us that to find the definite integral of a function Æ from ð¢ to ð£, we need to take an antiderivative of Æ, call it ð, and calculate ð(ð£)-ð(ð¢). Get some intuition into why this is true.

title: Telescoping series
description: Telescoping series is a series where all terms cancel out except for the first and last one. This makes such series easy to analyze. In this video, we use partial fraction decomposition to find sum of telescoping series.

title: Calvin Carter - Founder of Bottle Rocket Apps
description: The day after Steve Jobs announced that Apple was opening its platform to third party developers Calvin Carter bought pencils and a pad of paper and began sketching applications. Today developers at Bottle Rocket Apps still use pencil and paper as they begin the process of producing custom, high-end mobil apps for some the worldâs leading brands. Along the way they hold on to their passion and stay focused on their mission.

title: Divergent telescoping series
description: Telescoping series is a series where all terms cancel out except for the first and last one. This makes such series easy to analyze. In this video we take a close look at the series 1-1+1-1+1-...

title: When leasing might come out better than buying
description: Reviewing a scenario where leasing a vehicle could make more sense than buying.

title: Proving a sequence converges using the formal definition
description: Applying the formal definition of the limit of a sequence to prove that a sequence converges.

title: Infinite geometric series formula intuition
description: Sal uses a clever algebraic manipulation to find an expression for the sum of an infinite geometric series.

title: Defining the derivative of a function and using derivative notation
Beth Schmidt - Founder of Wishbone.org
description: Beth Schmidt was a Teach for America Corps Member teaching 10th Grade English at Locke High School in South Central, Los Angeles, when she asked her class to write about their passion and an after-school and summer program they wanted to attend. Their essays prompted her to find a way to make these life-changing opportunities available to her students. She started Wishbone to send students to programs that they otherwise wouldnât be able to afford.

title: Proof of infinite geometric series as a limit
description: Sal applies limits to the formula for the sum of a finite geometric series to get the sum of an infinite geometric series.

title: Toby Rush - CEO & Founder of EyeVerify
description: Toby Rush looks for hard problems to solve and ways to apply simple solutions for bringing products to market. He teamed with university scientist to develop EyeVerify Inc., which uses EyePrint ID, a highly accurate biometric technology that uses existing cameras on mobile devices to image and pattern match the blood vessels in the whites of the eye.

title: Personal taxes overview
description:
Benjamin Franklin (and several other writers/philosophers) tells us that "In this world nothing can be said to be certain, except death and taxes."  He's right.  

This tutorial focus on personal income tax.  Very important to watch if you ever plan on earning money (some of which the government will take for itself).

title: Standard and itemized tax deductions
description: Get a better understanding of how deductions work and which ones are right for you.

title: Filling out 1040EZ
description: Explanation of the 1040EZ based on the 2013 version of the form. Note that the standard deductions have changed since this video was created.Â For specific tax advice, consult with a tax professional.

title: Preparing your tax return for the first time - by Better Money HabitsÂ®
description: Filing your first tax return can seem overwhelming. Learn what steps you should take and how to prepare your first tax return before getting started.Â Content brought to you by our partner, Better Money HabitsÂ®.Â

title: Your guide to key tax terms - by Better Money Habits
description: Knowing tax vocabulary can make filling out the paperwork less intimidating when itâs time to file. This content is brought to you by our partner, Better Money Habits.Â

title: Protecting your identity at tax time - by Better Money HabitsÂ®
description: Your tax return is full of personal information, which is why itâs important to make sure it stays safe. Learn basic measures to help protect yourself from identity theft and tax scams. Content brought to you by our partner, Better Money HabitsÂ®.Â

title: Introduction: Paying for college
description: Hear from Sal and various experts on what it takes to pay for college.  Then, begin organizing your own financial aid plan with a timeline focused on paying for college.

title: Financial aid application process
description: Financial aid forms, including the FAFSA and CSS Profile, represent one of the first step in the financial aid process when you are applying to college.

title: Grants and scholarships
description: Free money?  It might sound too good to be true, but that's just what scholarships and grants - two terms used interchangeably - offer if you put in the time to apply!

title: Work study
description: Work-study, one component of a financial aid package, offers you the chance to earn extra funds through on-campus jobs while still going to college full-time.  Hear from admissions on how work-study operates and why it just might be the extra money you need to make college affordable.

title: Learn Why 'The Proof Is in the Pudding'
Loans
description: College loans can be a scary proposition, because unlike scholarships and grants, they have to be paid back (with interest!) after you finish school.  However, loans also represent an investment in your future and one that can absolutely be worth it if used in moderation.  Learn what sort of loans are out there and how to prioritize between them.

title: Terms to know when you repay student loans - by Better Money HabitsÂ®
description: Content brought to you by our partner, Better Money HabitsÂ®.Â

title: Student loan repayment options - by Better Money HabitsÂ®
description: There are lots of ways to approach student loan debt. This video gives you an overview of some of your repayment options. Content brought to you by our partner, Better Money HabitsÂ®.

title: Consolidating student loans - by Better Money HabitsÂ®
description: A good way to help ease the burden of student loans is to consolidate them into a single loan. Find out how it works, and if loan consolidation is a good choice for you. Content brought to you by our partner, Better Money HabitsÂ®.

title: Income-based student loan repayment plans - by Better Money HabitsÂ®
description: Sometimes you may not make enough money to cover your student loan payments. This video helps you better understand income-based student loan repayment plans to determine if theyâre your best option. Content brought to you by our partner, Better Money HabitsÂ®.

title: Financial aid packages
description: Once a college accepts you, they will take the information that you provided on your financial aid forms to determine your financial aid package.  Now comes one of the most important parts of the college admissions process: comparing offers to determine which of your top schools provided enough aid to make college affordable.

Using the tools of multivariable derivatives, we can find the maximum or minimum values of many multivariable functions.
